required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Dimethyl Fumarate (DMF, Tecfidera®) Persistence in RR-MS Patients Included in the French Patient Support Program OroSEP
clinical_study.official_title: Study on the Dimethyl Fumarate (DMF, Tecfidera®) Persistence of Remitting-relapsing Multiple Sclerosis (RR-MS) Patients Included in the French Patient Support Program (PSP) OroSEP

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with Oral Dimethyl Fumarate (DMF) Persistence at 6 Months
primary_outcome.description: Persistence is defined as the percentage of participant still being treated by oral DMF at 6 months, according to routine visit.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with Oral Dimethyl Fumarate (DMF) Persistence at Both 1 Month and 3 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Persistence is defined as the percentage of participants still being treated by oral DMF at both 1 month and 3 months, according to routine practice.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participant's with Adherence at 6 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Participant's adherence is assessed through the validated Girerd questionnaire. This is a 6-item self-questionnaire completed by participants with a scale of 0 for "Yes" and 1 for "No" for each question. Points for each question are summed up to obtain a global score between 0 if all the questions are ticked with "Yes" (reflecting a bad adherence), and 6 if all questions are ticked "No" (reflecting a good adherence).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants by Reason of Oral Dimethyl Fumarate (DMF) Discontinuation at 3 Months and 6 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Discontinuation of DMF therapy is defined by the presence of any of the following criteria: definitive discontinuation declared by the physician during routine follow-up visit through electronic case report form (eCRF); a temporary stop declared by the physician during routine visit at 3 months, without DMF resumption declared at 6 months by the physician; a switch to another DMT declared by the physician during routine follow-up visit through eCRF.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with Adverse Events (AEs)
secondary_outcome.description: An AE is any untoward medical occurrence in a patient or clinical investigation participant administered a pharmaceutical product and that does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. An AE can therefore be any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medicinal (investigational) product, whether or not related to the medicinal (investigational) product.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with Adverse Events (AEs) Related to Treatment
Percentage of Participants with Adverse Events (AEs) Leading to Treatment Discontinuation
Percentage of Participants with Adverse Events (AEs) of Interest
secondary_outcome.description: AEs of interest includes gastrointestinal disorders, flush, lymphopenia.

secondary_outcome.measure: Participant's Anxiety at Inclusion and at 6 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Participant's anxiety is assessed through the Generalized Anxiety Disorder - 7 (GAD-7) self-questionnaire. The GAD-7 is a questionnaire that is used primarily to detect possible generalized anxiety disorders, disorders of panic, social anxiety and post-traumatic stress disorder. It is more specifically a self-questionnaire (completed by the participant) consisting of 7 items rated from 0 to 3. The total score is obtained by adding the score obtained to each item (score ranging from 0 to 21). A total score greater than 7 is suggestive of a generalized anxiety disorder.

secondary_outcome.measure: Participant's Satisfaction Regarding Dimethyl Fumarate (DMF) Treatment at 6 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Participant's satisfaction regarding DMF treatment is assessed through the validated Treatment Satisfaction Questionnaire for Medication (TSQM-9) score completed by the participant. The TSQM-9, a 9-items questionnaire, designed as a general measure of treatment satisfaction with medication. TSQM items are answered on 5- or 7-point Likert type scale and cover three domains, corresponding to distinct aspects related to the satisfaction of participants with their treatment (effectiveness, convenience and global satisfaction). A score can be obtained for each domain by summing the corresponding items transformed on a 0-100 scale. Higher value indicates more satisfaction, better perceived effectiveness, lower burden associated with better convenience.

secondary_outcome.measure: Participant's Satisfaction Regarding their Participation in OroSEP Patient Support Program (PSP)
secondary_outcome.description: Participant's satisfaction is assessed at Month 6 using a questionnaire completed by the participant consisting of 3 questions. Questions 1 and 2 are assessed using a Likert scale (1-5) with scale range 1= Strongly disagree to 5= Strongly agree. Question 3 is assessed using the net promoter scale (1-7), where 1 indicates "not at all likely" and 7 indicates "extremely likely". Higher values indicate higher satisfaction.

secondary_outcome.measure: Neurologists' Satisfaction Regarding their Participation in OroSEP Patient Support Program (PSP)
secondary_outcome.description: Neurologist's satisfaction is assessed after the last participant last visit of the site center using a 10-item questionnaire, completed by the physician. Question (Q) 1, Q3, Q4, Q6, Q7, Q8= is answered "Yes/No"; Q2= Lack of time, Lack of interest, Patient refused, Forget, No registration form available, Registration process too complicated / Other: specify; Q5= The availability of the call center, The monitoring of patient compliance, The coordination of biological assessments, Other: specify; Q9: 1 bad satisfaction, 10 good satisfaction and Q10 was an open answer.

arm_group.description: SoC neurologists will include and follow-up all study participants who receive DMF according to their standard of care practice (non-coached participants).
OPSP neurologists will include and follow-up all study participants who receive DMF according to their standard of care practice and the OroSEP PSP (coached participants).

intervention.description: DMF as prescribed as standard of care.
PSPs is to support patient care.

study_pop.textblock: Study population included participants with RR-MS treated with DMF in clinical practice.

patient_data.ipd_description: In accordance with Biogen's Clinical Trial Transparency and Data Sharing Policy on http://clinicalresearch.biogen.com/
